user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_QueuePut_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_QueuePut_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const void *data, size_t size, uint32 flags)
{
    int32                            return_code;
    int                              result;
    struct timespec                  ts;
    OS_impl_queue_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_queue_table, *token);

    /*
     * NOTE - using a zero timeout here for the same reason that QueueGet does ---
     * checking the attributes and doing the actual send is non-atomic, and if
     * two threads call QueuePut() at the same time on a nearly-full queue,
     * one could block.
     */
    memset(&ts, 0, sizeof(ts));

    /* send message */
    do
    {
        result = mq_timedsend(impl->id, data, size, 1, &ts);
    } while (result == -1 && errno == EINTR);

    if (result == 0)
    {
        return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
    }
    else if (errno == ETIMEDOUT)
    {
        return_code = OS_QUEUE_FULL;
    }
    else
    {
        /* Something else went wrong */
        return_code = OS_ERROR;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_QueuePut_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_queue_internal_record_t OS_impl_queue_table[OS_MAX_QUEUES]
...
typedef struct
{
    mqd_t id;
} OS_impl_queue_internal_record_t
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_QUEUE_FULL (-9)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The remaining lines (variable declarations, the final return statement, typedefs and macro definitions shown in the supplemental code) are straightforward declarations or simple return/value mappings and do not by themselves create unreachable code paths. The function has a single entry and a single exit point; standard declarations (int32 return_code; int result; struct timespec ts; OS_impl_queue_internal_record_t *impl;) and the final "return return_code;" are always reachable when the function executes and do not introduce conditional or dead branches. The macro/type definitions provided (OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET, OS_impl_queue_table, OS_ObjectIndexFromToken, the integer constant definitions, and the typedefs) are simple lookups or aliases and do not contain internal control-flow that would render source lines in OS_QueuePut_Impl unreachable. Therefore only the listed fragments need further investigation for potential unreachable-code issues under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
